subject: Career
title: Ageism in Career Transitions
description: A micro-lesson that makes Ageism in Career Transitions usable.

hook.text: 'Aren't you too old to start over?' She was 42. The bias was real but not insurmountable.

buildup.text: Age discrimination in hiring is well-documented. AARP found 78% of older workers witnessed or experienced it.

discovery.text: But research also shows older career changers bring judgment, networks, and pattern recognition juniors lack.

twist.text: Companies losing institutional knowledge to retirement now actively seek experienced career changers.

climax.text: Counter ageism with energy, adaptability, and a portfolio that proves current skills.

punchline.text: Experience isn't a liability. Stagnation is.

quiz.question: What advantage do older career changers bring?
